page.title: 17Transport, Paddock Wood
page.content: The station is popular with commuters. About 1500 tickets are sold each week day.Approximately 80% of the people using the station have season tickets. The majority of the commuters travel to London but some go to Maidstone or the coastal towns. It is an important junction particularly because of its link with various industries.These include Rowntree Mackintosh,the Transfesa terminal and Mack and Edwards.British Railway's Red Star Service uses the station for a good reason.It is also near the motorways.The Orient Express sometimes passes through Paddock Wood on its way to the Continent. The live rail holds 750 volts and partly for this reason there are warning signs that trespassers will be prosecuted.
